file_system_forensic.title: File System Forensic
file_system_forensic.description: Analyze storage devices and find the evidence
file_system_forensic.introduction: A suspicious hard disk has been seized. You must mount it, examine the file system, and find the hidden evidence. Use Linux commands to discover what happened.

tasks.title: Connect the hard disk to the workstation
tasks.details: Click on the hard disk to physically connect it to the forensic PC

onInteract.message:
Hard disk connected as /dev/sdb
Use 'lsblk' to display available devices

mountContent.suspicious.log:
2024-10-15 03:45:12 - Unauthorized access attempt
2024-10-15 03:45:34 - Login from 192.168.1.50
2024-10-15 03:47:21 - File system modified: /etc/shadow
password: forensic2024
mountContent.system_info.txt:
System: Ubuntu 22.04 LTS
Kernel: 5.15.0-89-generic
Last boot: 2024-10-15 03:30:00

tasks.title: List connected devices
tasks.details: Use 'lsblk' to see available disks

tasks.title: Mount the device
tasks.details: Use 'mount /dev/sdb1 /mnt/evidence' to mount the partition

tasks.title: Explore the contents
tasks.details: Use 'ls /mnt/evidence' to see files on the disk

tasks.title: Search for suspicious files
tasks.details: Use 'cat /mnt/evidence/suspicious.log' to read the log

tasks.title: Search for password in the log
tasks.details: Use 'grep password /mnt/evidence/suspicious.log'

network_forensic.title: Network Forensic
network_forensic.description: Analyze network traffic and system logs
network_forensic.introduction: A server has been compromised. You need to analyze authentication logs and network traffic to identify the attacker. First, you must trace the signal to locate the server.

customCommands.name: trace-connection
customCommands.output: [*] Initiating Network Traffic Analysis... [TARGET: Identify C2 IP Address]
customCommands.onSuccess: Trace Complete. Target IP Identified: 10.0.0.5. Use 'nmap 10.0.0.5' to scan the target.

customCommands.name: nmap
customCommands.description: Network exploration tool and security / port scanner
customCommands.output:
Scanning 10.0.0.5...
PORT    STATE SERVICE
22/tcp  open  ssh
80/tcp  open  http
443/tcp open  https

Vulnerability detected on port 22 (SSH-2.0-OpenSSH_7.6p1).

tasks.title: Trace signal to server
tasks.details: Use 'trace-connection' to locate the remote server

tasks.title: Scan the target IP
tasks.details: Use 'nmap 10.0.0.5' to scan the identified target

tasks.title: Connect to the remote server
tasks.details: Click on the server to establish an SSH connection

onInteract.message:

tasks.title: List system logs
tasks.details: The remote server automatically mounts logs in /var/log/network. Use ls to explore his content.

tasks.title: Read authentication logs
tasks.details: Use 'cat /var/log/network/auth.log'

tasks.title: Search for failed SSH attempts
tasks.details: Use 'grep "Failed password" /var/log/network/auth.log'

tasks.title: Analyze packet capture
tasks.details: Use 'tcpdump' to see captured traffic statistics

memory_forensic.title: Memory Forensic
memory_forensic.description: Analyze RAM memory dump to find artifacts
memory_forensic.introduction: A RAM memory dump contains traces of malware. Analyze it using forensic tools to discover what malicious processes were running.

customCommands.name: memdump-info
customCommands.description: Display memory dump metadata and statistics

tasks.details: Use 'lsblk' to confirm the connected device

tasks.details: Use 'mount /dev/sdc1 /mnt/memdump'

tasks.title: List dump files
tasks.details: Use 'ls /mnt/memdump'

tasks.title: Analyze processes
tasks.details: Use 'cat /mnt/memdump/process_list.txt'

tasks.details: Use 'memdump-info' to display memory dump analysis and statistics

tasks.title: Scan for malicious signatures
tasks.details: Use 'find-malware' to identify suspicious processes and malware in memory
